docs.text: " virus " is a monster movie without a monster .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: any movie with a hurdle that large to overcome had better be pretty damn good otherwise .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sadly , " virus " does not deliver , on any level .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the movie opens with the russian space station mir about to transmit something ( we never find out what ) to a big boat with lots of satellites on it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sudddenly , a wave of colorful lightning comes flying through space , and winds up destroying mir and using it to transmit itself to the aforementioned big boat .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: cut to seven days later , we meet donald sutherland and his band of seafaring vultures .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: see , they spend all their time sailing around looking for dead-in-the-water ships to rescue , and then collect the reward money .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: at least , i * think * that's what they do .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: along with many other things in the film , their reason for being out in the middle of the ocean isn't really explained .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: so , they stumble upon this big boat with lots of satellites on it , and decide to haul it back to russian waters .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the only problem is , the crew starts disappearing one-by-one and turning into borg .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: yes , borg .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: complete with the red laser beam in place of an eye .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: apparently , this alien lifeform can only survive if inside something electrical .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: so , it creates make-shift machines and uses humans for " spare parts " .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: blah , blah , blah .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i could go on forever describing the ludicrous so-called plot , but i won't .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: suffice it to say the most original thing about this movie is having donald sutherland play an irish man ( ! ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: everything else in this movie has been taken from other ( better ) movies .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: for example , many of the machines resemble those found in the little-seen japanese movie , " tetsuo-the iron man " .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and the plot is right out of " aliens " .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the funny thing is , i was actually expecting to enjoy this movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i have a soft spot for cheesy monster movies , like last years under-appreciated " deep rising " .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but " virus " , as i mentioned earlier , doesn't even have a monster .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it just has a big pile of circuits and wires and expects the audience to fear this ridiculous looking contraption .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " virus " is the type of movie that really makes you wonder what the screenwriter was thinking about when he wrote it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: besides the lame " monster " , it's chock full of dialogue that no real person would ever say , and situations that no real person would ever allow themselves to get into .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: for example , there is a scene late in the movie in which one of the characters actually attempts to * negotiate * with the alien !
docs.label: negative

docs.text: now , i don't know about you , but if i came upon a lifeform that viewed mankind as a virus to be eliminated , i doubt that i would attempt to reason with it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that makes about as much sense as a baby squirrel calmly asking a fierce predator to spare his life .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: finally , " virus " isn't scary .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the least the filmmakers could have done was to make the movie just a little scary .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as it is , it's about as frightening as a box of cookies .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: skip " virus " .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if it's a cool monster movie you want , rent the far superior ( and the granddaddy of this genre ) " aliens " .
docs.label: negative
